page.title: 03POPULATION
page.content: Our survey showed that about half of the children have one or both sets of grandparents living within a twenty mile radius of Southminster.Many of these live near London in Romford or Ilford, which bears out the fact that there has been a migration from the city in recent years. There are still some old Southminster families with names like Hurrell, Stammers and Harvey. There was a rapid expansion in the population in the 1960's, resulting in an imbalance in the age structure so that there are now high numbers of school leavers.The numbers of primary school aged children fell to 160 in 1983 but is gradually rising again now.
